thread.title: Seattle Seahawks coach Pete Carroll on Derrick Coleman: “We don’t know anything”
thread.title_full: Seattle Seahawks coach Pete Carroll on Derrick Coleman: “We don’t know anything”

author: Bob Condotta
title: Seattle Seahawks coach Pete Carroll on Derrick Coleman: “We don’t know anything”
text:
Seattle Seahawks coach Pete Carroll on Derrick Coleman: “We don’t know anything” Originally published October 16, 2015 at 2:58 pm Seattle Seahawks coach Pete Carroll said Friday he has yet to talk to suspended fullback Derrick Coleman since his auto accident Wednesday night and will wait for more information before deciding his future with the team. 
Seattle Seahawks coach Pete Carroll said Friday that he is still waiting to talk to fullback Derrick Coleman and will then figure out how to proceed with the player’s immediate future with the team. 
Coleman was arrested on investigation of hit and run following a two-car accident Wednesday in Bellevue. He is due to be released from King County Jail Friday with the investigation underway. A decision on charges will wait for toxicology results, which could take a month or so. 
Carroll said after Friday’s practice he had yet to talk to Coleman but anticipates being able to do that Saturday morning. Coleman has been indefinitely suspended by the team with his spot on the 53-man roster filled Thursday by the re-signing of receiver B.J.Daniels. 
“We haven’t talked to him nor seen him at all,” Carroll said. “Can’t wait for him to get out and we’ll see him first thing in the morning and I don’t have any information about it right now. … he had a serious accident and there were some serious issues there. We are concerned for everybody’s health and that’s the first thing we want to take a look at. Most Read Stories
